physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Patient appeared well, alert, and oriented; jaundiced with icteric sclerae. There was an ecchymosis (2 cm in diameter) on the right thigh.
Chest radiograph showed stable bilateral apical lung opacities.
On the 10th hospital day, laparoscopic examination showed no evidence of metastatic carcinoma.
Overall physical examination noted no abnormalities; there were no allergies or use of illicit drugs.
